Coalescent models

class phasegen.coalescent_models.CoalescentModel

Bases: ABC

Abstract class for coalescent models.

abstract get_rate(s1: int, s2: int)

Get rate for a merger collapsing k1 lineages into k2 lineages.

Parameters:

  • s1 (int) – Number of lineages in the first state.

  • s2 (int) – Number of lineages in the second state.

Return type:

float

Returns:

The rate.

abstract get_rate_infinite_alleles(n: int, s1: numpy.ndarray, s2: numpy.ndarray)

Get rate between two infinite alleles states. \({ (a_1,...,a_n) \in \mathbb{Z}^+ : \sum_{i=1}^{n} a_i = n \}\).

Parameters:

  • n (int) – Number of lineages.

  • s1 (ndarray) – Sample configuration 1.

  • s2 (ndarray) – Sample configuration 2.

Return type:

float

Returns:

The rate.

abstract get_sample_config_probs(n: int)

Get the probabilities of all possible sample configurations.

Parameters:

n (int) – Number of lineages.

Return type:

Dict[Tuple, float]

Returns:

class phasegen.coalescent_models.StandardCoalescent

Bases: CoalescentModel

Standard (Kingman) coalescent model.

get_rate(s1: int, s2: int)

Get rate for a merger collapsing k1 lineages into k2 lineages.

Parameters:

  • s1 (int) – Number of lineages in the first state.

  • s2 (int) – Number of lineages in the second state.

Return type:

float

Returns:

The rate.

get_rate_infinite_alleles(n: int, s1: numpy.ndarray, s2: numpy.ndarray)

Get exponential rate for a merger of k out of b lineages.

Parameters:

  • n (int) – Number of lineages.

  • s1 (ndarray) – Sample configuration 1.

  • s2 (ndarray) – Sample configuration 2.

Return type:

float

Returns:

The rate.

get_sample_config_probs(n: int)

Get the probabilities of all possible sample configurations. Note that this currently only works for a single population.

Parameters:

n (int) – The number of lineages

Return type:

Dict[Tuple, float]

Returns:

The probabilities of all possible sample configurations.

class phasegen.coalescent_models.BetaCoalescent(alpha: float)

Bases: CoalescentModel

Beta coalescent model.

__init__(alpha: float)

Initialize the beta coalescent model.

Parameters:

alpha (float) – The alpha parameter of the beta coalescent model.

get_rate(s1: int, s2: int)

Get rate for a merger collapsing k1 lineages into k2 lineages.

Parameters:

  • s1 (int) – Number of lineages in the first state.

  • s2 (int) – Number of lineages in the second state.

Return type:

float

Returns:

The rate.

get_rate_infinite_alleles(n: int, s1: numpy.ndarray, s2: numpy.ndarray)

Get the rate of a merger of k out of b lineages under the infinite alleles model.

Parameters:

  • n (int) – Number of lineages.

  • s1 (ndarray) – First state.

  • s2 (ndarray) – Second state.

Return type:

float

Returns:

The rate.

get_sample_config_probs(n: int)

Get the probabilities of all possible sample configurations.

Parameters:

n (int) – The total number of lineages

Return type:

Dict[Tuple, float]

Returns:

The probabilities of all possible sample configurations.

abstract get_density()

Get the density function of the coalescent model.

Return type:

Callable

Returns:

The density function of the coalescent model.

get_rate(i: int, j: int)

Get exponential rate for a merger of j out of i lineages.

Parameters:

  • i (int) – The number of lineages.

  • j (int) – The number of lineages that merge.

Returns:

The rate.

get_sample_config_probs(n: int)

Get the probabilities of all possible sample configurations.

Parameters:

n (int) – The number of lineages

Return type:

Dict[Tuple, float]

Returns:

The probabilities of all possible sample configurations.

abstract get_rate_infinite_alleles(n: int, s1: numpy.ndarray, s2: numpy.ndarray)

Get rate between two infinite alleles states. \({ (a_1,...,a_n) \in \mathbb{Z}^+ : \sum_{i=1}^{n} a_i = n \}\).

Parameters:

  • n (int) – Number of lineages.

  • s1 (ndarray) – Sample configuration 1.

  • s2 (ndarray) – Sample configuration 2.

Return type:

float

Returns:

The rate.
